references.reason: This paper introduces the continuum random tree (CRT), which is a fundamental object in the study of random trees and is used in the construction of the Brownian sphere.

references.paper_title: The continuum random tree. II. An overview.
references.reason: This paper provides an overview of the CRT and its properties, further solidifying its importance in the field.

references.paper_title: The Brownian map is the scaling limit of uniform random plane quadrangulations.
references.reason: This paper establishes the Brownian map as the scaling limit of uniform random plane quadrangulations, a key result connecting discrete and continuous models.

references.paper_title: Uniqueness and universality of the Brownian map.
references.reason: This paper proves the uniqueness and universality of the Brownian map, which confirms its role as a universal scaling limit.

references.paper_title: Planar maps are well labeled trees.
references.reason: This paper introduces the Cori-Vauquelin-Schaeffer (CVS) bijection, which maps labeled trees to planar maps and is a key part of constructing Brownian spheres.
